greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: One third of the least common multiple of 3 and n^2+n+1.
comment: This is a subset of A051176 and is also one third of A130723.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0, 0, 3, 0, 0, -3, 0, 0, 1).
formula: Conjecture: a(n) = A046163(n), n>0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 13 2008
example: a(4)=7 because 4^2+4+1 =21, the LCM of 3 and 21 is 21 and 21/3=7.
program: (PARI) for(n=0,50, print1(lcm(3, n^2 + n +1)/3, ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 26 2017
results.author: _W. Neville Holmes_, Jul 14 2007
